tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE restraining_orders (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  individual_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  restraining_order_number VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
  date_issued DATE NOT NULL,
  expiration_date DATE,
  issued_by VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE individuals_with_restraining_orders (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100),
    address VARCHAR(255),
    restraining_order_start_date DATE,
    restraining_order_end_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE Addresses (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  individual_id INT,
  address VARCHAR(255),
  city VARCHAR(100),
  state VARCHAR(2),
  zip_code VARCHAR(10),
  FOREIGN KEY (individual_id) REFERENCES Individuals(id)
);

CREATE TABLE RestrainingOrders (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  individual_id INT,
  restraining_order_nbr VARCHAR(50),
  issued_by VARCHAR(100),
  reason TEXT,
  date_issued DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (individual_id) REFERENCES Individuals(id)
);

CREATE TABLE individuals_with_restraining_orders (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    full_name VARCHAR(255),
    address VARCHAR(255),
    phone_number VARCHAR(15),
    date_of_birth DATE
);

CREATE TABLE restraining_orders (
    order_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    individual_id INT,
    issue_date DATE,
    expiration_date DATE,
    reason TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (individual_id) REFERENCES individuals_with_restraining_orders(id)
);

CREATE TABLE security_incidents (
    incident_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_date DATE,
    description TEXT,
    individual_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (individual_id) REFERENCES individuals_with_restraining_orders(id)
);

CREATE TABLE restraining_orders (
    order_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    individual_id INT,
    issued_date DATE,
    court STRING,
    reason STRING
);
